alert.note: Alert for Alger; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 17 at 11:08PM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM FRIDAY TO 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and areas of blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds initially south as high as 35 mph. By evening, winds will become northwesterly and may gust as high as 50 mph, especially near the Lake Superior shoreline. * WHERE...Alger, Luce, Southern Schoolcraft and Northern Schoolcraft Counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM Friday to 7 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous road conditions with snowfall rates exceeding an inch an hour at times Friday afternoon into early evening. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and result in snow drifts on roadways. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is the potential for near blizzard conditions mainly along the Lake Superior shoreline Friday night. Travelers should remain vigilant for future forecasts and plan on extra time to reach their destination or consider adjusting their travel plans.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Alger; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft
